name: alternate
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to happen or exist one after the other repeatedly

example.eg: She alternated between cheerfulness and deep despair.
example.egtrans: 她时而情绪亢奋，时而又深陷绝望之中。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something happen or exist one after the other repeatedly

example.eg: He alternated working in the office with long tours overseas.
example.egtrans: 他在办公室工作一段时间后就会安排一次海外长途旅行。

name: alternate
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: with first one thing, then another thing, and then the first thing again

example.eg: a dessert with alternate layers of chocolate and cream
example.egtrans: 巧克力和奶油层叠的甜点

trans_examp.trans_en: If something happens on alternate days, it happens every second day.

example.eg: Private cars are banned from the city on alternate days.
example.egtrans: 该市私家车限隔日出行。

trans_examp.trans_en: An alternate plan or method is one that you can use if you do not want to use another one.

name: alternate
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person or thing that can take the place of another

example.eg: David was too sick to attend, so Janet served as his alternate.
example.egtrans: 戴维重病不能出席，珍妮特作为他的替代者参加。
